ResourceHeader.ResourceName: MMS-1 FPI DES Level-2 Burst electron distribution functions (CDF)
ResourceHeader.Description: This dataset provides the full electron distribution functions at the BURST cadence (30 ms). The data is provided in units of phase space density. The reference frame is related to the instrument frame, and is called near-GSE. For more information on the FPI instruments, data set, and user guide, please see: MMS Science Data Center (https://lasp.colorado.edu/mms/sdc/public/datasets/fpi/) MMS FPI Data Users and Products Guide (https://lasp.colorado.edu/galaxy/display/MFDPG/MMS+FPI+Data+Users+and+Products+Guide) FPI Release Notes (https://lasp.colorado.edu/mms/sdc/public/datasets/fpi/mms-FPIReleaseNotes-220217.pdf)
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: FPI data, as a data set of the MMS-SMART data products, are open to all scientists and the public (Users). Users should contact the MMS-SMART Principal Investigator (PI) J. L. Burch and B. Giles the FPI Lead to consult on the appropriate use of instrument data. Users should acknowledge the sources of data used in all publications, presentations, and reports. Please send information on the use of these data to: PI: J. L. Burch [jburch@swri.edu] FPI Lead: B. Giles [barbara.giles@gsfc.nasa.gov] We suggest to add the following lines into the acknowledgments: The authors acknowledge NASA, CNES (Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales) and CNRS (Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique) for their support to the MMS/FPI team and the CDPP (Centre de Données de la Physique des Plasmas) for the distribution of the MMS/SCM data. and if PI/coI are not part of the publication list, then we suggest to add Specifically, we acknowledge J. L. Burch for use of data from the MMS-SMART mission, B. Giles for use of FPI data. For more informations about data rights and rules, see MMS Science Data center The following paper should also be used to reference: Pollock, C., T. Moore, A. Jacques, J. Burch, U. Gliese, Y. Saito, T. Omoto, L. Avanov, A. Barrie, V. Coffey, J. Dorelli, D. Gershman, B. Giles, T. Rosnack, C. Salo, S. Yokota, M. Adrian, C. Aoustin, C. Auletti, S. Aung, V. Bigio, N. Cao, M. Chandler, D. Rodriguez, J. Rouzaud, A. Rucker, Y. Saito, M. Samara, J.-A. Sauvaud, D. Schuster, M. Shappirio, K. Shelton, D. Sher, D. Smith, K. Smith, S. Smith, D. Steinfeld, R. Szymkiewicz, K. Tanimoto, J. AccessURL.Name: REGARDS
AccessURL.Description: Access via CNES Data Archive for CDPP

Parameter.Name: Data quality error flag
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Vector of Data Quality Indicator Flag at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: A Value of Zero signifies no Quality Errors. For Non-Zero Values: Bit-0=Manually flagged Interval, Bit-1=Overcounting/Saturation Effects likely present in Sky Map, Bit-2=Compression Pipeline Error

Parameter.Name: Compression Flag
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Compression Lossless/Lossy Indicator Flag at Survey Start Time

Parameter.Name: Step Table Parity
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Step Table Parity, this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: The FPI/DES alternates between two Tables, designated even (0) and odd (1).

Parameter.Name: Start Del-Phi Count
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Del-Phi (Observatory Spin Phase) Count at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Nominally, the Spin Phase Counts range over [0000,5759] Counts. Each Count represents 1/16 of a Degree (0.0625°) of Observatory Spin Phase. Zero Spin Phase Angle indicates that the Observatory +X-axis is aligned with the Sun Sensor Axis.

Parameter.Name: Start Del-Phi Angle
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Del-Phi (Observatory Spin Phase) Angle at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Nominally, the Spin Phase Angles range over [0°,360°). Each Count represents 1/16 of a Degree (0.0625°) of Observatory Spin Phase. Zero Spin Phase Angle indicates that the Observatory +X-axis is aligned with the Sun Sensor Axis.

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Azimuth Angle, Phi
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Azimuth Angle, Phi
Parameter.Caveats: Azimuth Angles in the Instrument Frame, i.e., the Azimuthal Angle of the Instrument Look Direction

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Azimuth Angle, Phi, Delta Value
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Azimuth Angle, Phi, Bin Delta Value

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Distribution
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Instrument Distribution. Column 1 Labels from MMS1_DES_PHI_BRST: [sector00,sector01,sector02,sector03,sector04,sector05,sector06,sector07,sector08,sector09,sector10,sector11,sector12,sector13,sector14,sector15,sector16,sector17,sector18,sector19,sector20,sector21,sector22,sector23,sector24,sector25,sector26,sector27,sector28,sector29,sector30,sector31]. Column 2 Labels from MMS1_DES_THETA_BRST: [5.6250 deg,16.875 deg,28.125 deg,39.375 deg,50.625 deg,61.875 deg,73.125 deg,84.375 deg,95.625 deg,106.88 deg,118.13 deg,129.38 deg,140.63 deg,151.88 deg,163.13 deg,174.38 deg]. Column 3 Labels from MMS1_DES_ENERGY_BRST: [energy00,energy01,energy02,energy03,energy04,energy05,energy06,energy07,energy08,energy09,energy10,energy11,energy12,energy13,energy14,energy15,energy16,energy17,energy18,energy19,energy20,energy21,energy22,energy23,energy24,energy25,energy26,energy27,energy28,energy29,energy30,energy31].
Parameter.Caveats: Azimuth Bin: Sector Index=00 looks after (Spin Phase) the Sun Direction, ..., Sector Index=31 looks before the Sun Direction. Head Field of View: Pixel Index=00 looks to Zenith, ..., Pixel Index=15 looks to Nadir. FPI Operations nominally bin Data from 64 Energy Filters into 32 pairwise Energy Bins, indexed 00-31. Nominally, Bins are indexed in increasing Energy Order. See the FPI Documents for Details.

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Distribution, Error
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Instrument Distribution, 1-sigma Error. Column 1 Labels from MMS1_DES_PHI_BRST: [sector00,sector01,sector02,sector03,sector04,sector05,sector06,sector07,sector08,sector09,sector10,sector11,sector12,sector13,sector14,sector15,sector16,sector17,sector18,sector19,sector20,sector21,sector22,sector23,sector24,sector25,sector26,sector27,sector28,sector29,sector30,sector31]. Column 2 Labels from MMS1_DES_THETA_BRST: [5.6250 deg,16.875 deg,28.125 deg,39.375 deg,50.625 deg,61.875 deg,73.125 deg,84.375 deg,95.625 deg,106.88 deg,118.13 deg,129.38 deg,140.63 deg,151.88 deg,163.13 deg,174.38 deg]. Column 3 Labels from MMS1_DES_ENERGY_BRST: [energy00,energy01,energy02,energy03,energy04,energy05,energy06,energy07,energy08,energy09,energy10,energy11,energy12,energy13,energy14,energy15,energy16,energy17,energy18,energy19,energy20,energy21,energy22,energy23,energy24,energy25,energy26,energy27,energy28,energy29,energy30,energy31].
Parameter.Caveats: Azimuth Bin: Sector Index=00 looks after (Spin Phase) the Sun Direction, ..., Sector Index=31 looks before the Sun Direction. Head Field of View: Pixel Index=00 looks to Zenith, ..., Pixel Index=15 looks to Nadir. FPI Operations nominally bin Data from 64 Energy Filters into 32 pairwise Energy Bins, indexed 00-31. Nominally, Bins are indexed in increasing Energy Order. See the FPI Documents for Details.

Parameter.Name: Sector De-Spin P Value
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Sector De-Spin P Value, this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: This Variable records the P-Value used to De-Spin this Burst Sky Map onboard. See the FPI Documents for Details.

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Zenith Angle, Theta
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Zenith Angle, Theta
Parameter.Caveats: Pixel Zenith Angles, i.e., the Polar Angle of the Instrument Look Direction

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Zenith Angle, Theta, Delta Value
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Zenith Angle, Theta, Bin Delta Value

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Energy
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Parity 0/1 Energy
Parameter.Caveats: Energies (Parity 0/1) in the 64-step FPI Energy Table

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Energy, Delta Value
Parameter.Description: MMS1 FPI/DES Electron Burst Survey Sky Map Energy, Delta Value
Parameter.Caveats: Note that the Deltas are provided to indicate that the FPI is reporting the Energy Bin Centers. The Deltas do not necessarily reflect the Energy Bandwidth that is sampled by the FPI for a given Energy Step.
